title: 820-2915-A boots with white screen
message:
Hello,
i have a 820-2915-A which starts up just fine but after the apple Logo finishes loading and i choose an account the screen stays just white. It had liquid damage and has a new keyboard. The board it shelf looks very clean. No evidence of water there. Same thing if i want so reinstall the OS. But Apple Logo and Boot device selection menu is displayed perfectly fine as long as i want (did not turn white after some time). Can this be related to C9560? i measured voltage and for a few seconds it is 1.5V as it should be but than it turns into 1,355V and stays there.
Thanks for any help!
Regards
Felix

title: 820-2915-A boots with white screen
message: GPU failure. If the board and machine has been cleaned well enough you should take it to Apple for a free repair under the GPU warranty program.

title: 820-2915-A boots with white screen
message: Thank you for this incredible fast reply :)  Some probe points are slightly brown but i hope they won´t open it if i take it directly to the store. Thanks for the advice.

title: 820-2915-A boots with white screen
message: Uhm, someone is going to open it and if it has obvious corrosion it will be rejected. Make sure it is as clean as possible. Maybe post a link to a good HiRes picture here so I can judge if this is going to be rejected.

title: 820-2915-A boots with white screen
message:
I've taken LOTS of these boards in. just make sure the water indicators are white, and that there isn't any noticeable corrosion/damage or sticky keys and you should be alright. 

Note: If you take too many of them in they will start to have a freak out lmao.
